text: The general election will be held on November 3, 2020, to elect a member of the United States Senate to represent the State of West Virginia, concurrently with the 2020 U.S. presidential election, as well as other elections to the United States Senate in other states and elections to the United States House of Representatives and various state and local elections. The Democratic and Republican party primary election will be held on June 9, 2020. ==Federal offices== ===President=== ===Senate=== ===House of Representatives=== ==Governor== ==State Legislature== ===State Senate=== 17 of the 34 seats in the West Virginia State Senate will have an election, including 11 Republican- held seats and 6 Democratic-held seats. Four incumbents chose not to seek re- election: Democrats Paul Hardesty, Roman Prezioso, and Corey Palumbo and Republican Kenny Mann. Republicans currently hold a 20-14 veto-proof majority in the senate. Democrats would need a net gain of 4 seats to flip the chamber.https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_State_Senate_elections,_2020https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_State_Senate ===House of Delegates=== All 100 seats in the West Virginia House of Delegates will have an election. Nineteen incumbents chose not to seek re-election: 11 Democrats and 8 Republicans. Republicans currently hold a 59-41 veto-proof majority in the house of delegates. Democrats would need a net gain of 10 seats to flip the chamber.https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_House_of_Delegates_elections,_2020https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_House_of_Delegates ==Attorney General== Republican incumbent Patrick Morrisey was re-elected with 51.63% of the vote in 2016. He is seeking re- election.https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_Attorney_General_election,_2020 === Republican primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * Patrick Morrisey, incumbent Attorney General of West Virginia and nominee for U.S. Senate in 2018https://ballotpedia.org/Patrick_Morrisey === Democratic primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * Sam Petsonk, attorneyhttps://www.samforwv.com/ * Isaac Sponaugle, state delegatehttps://ballotpedia.org/Isaac_Sponaugle === Polling === {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;text-align:center;" |- valign=bottom ! Poll source ! Date(s) administered ! Sample size ! Margin of error ! style="width:100px;"| Patrick Morrisey (R) ! style="width:100px;"| Sam Petsonk (D) ! Undecided |- |style="text-align:left;"|Triton Polling & Research/WMOV |September 29–30, 2020 |525 (RV) |± 4.3% ||53% |41% |6% |} === General election === ==Secretary of State== Republican incumbent Mac Warner was elected with 48.52% of the vote in 2016, defeating Democratic incumbent Natalie Tennant. He is seeking re- election.https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_Secretary_of_State_election,_2020 === Republican primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * Mac Warner, incumbent Secretary of State of West Virginia ===== Withdrawn ===== * Tyrin Smith-Holmes of Huntingtonhttps://www.weirtondailytimes.com/news/local- news/2019/09/2020-candidates-file-early-in-west-virginia/ === Democratic primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * Natalie Tennant, former Secretary of State, candidate for Governor of West Virginia in 2011, and nominee for U.S. Senate in 2014https://ballotpedia.org/Natalie_Tennant ===== Withdrawn ===== * Brent Pauley, journalist at EnAct West Virginiahttp://enactwv.org/author/brent/ === Polling === === General election === ==Treasurer== Democratic incumbent John Perdue was re-elected with 50.33% of the vote in 2016. He is seeking re- election.https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_Treasurer_election,_2020 === Democratic primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * John Perdue, incumbent West Virginia State Treasurer and candidate for Governor of West Virginia in 2011 === Republican primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * Riley Moore, former state delegate === Polling === {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;text-align:center;" |- valign=bottom ! Poll source ! Date(s) administered ! Sample size ! Margin of error ! style="width:100px;"| John Perdue (D) ! style="width:100px;"| Riley Moore (R) ! Undecided |- |style="text-align:left;"|Triton Polling & Research/WMOV |September 29–30, 2020 |525 (RV) |± 4.3% ||48% |44% |8% |} === General election === ==Auditor== Republican incumbent JB McCuskey was elected with 58.48% of the vote in 2016. He is seeking re- election.https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_Auditor_election,_2020 === Republican primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * JB McCuskey, incumbent West Virginia State Auditor === Democratic primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * Mary Ann Claytor, accountant and auditor, nominee for West Virginia State Auditor in 2016, candidate for West Virginia State Senate in 2018, and former candidate for the West Virginia House of Delegates in 2020https://ballotpedia.org/Mary_Ann_Claytor === General election === ==Commissioner of Agriculture== Republican incumbent Kent Leonhardt was elected with 48.41% of the vote in 2016, defeating Democratic incumbent Walt Helmick. He is seeking re- election.https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_Agriculture_Commissioner_election,_2020 === Republican primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * Kent Leonhardt, incumbent West Virginia Commissioner of Agriculture * Roy Ramey, farm owner and American Freedom nominee for West Virginia State Senate in 2014https://www.facebook.com/pg/RameyforAg/about/https://ballotpedia.org/Roy_L._Ramey === Democratic primary === ====Candidates==== ===== Declared ===== * Bob Beach, state senatorhttps://ballotpedia.org/Robert_Beach_(West_Virginia) * William Keplinger, farmer and businessmanhttps://www.herald- dispatch.com/elections/wv_candidates/w-va-commissioner-of-agriculture- candidate-william-jr- keplinger-d/article_07f72934-6ecb-11ea-8994-b39d419cd3d4.html * Dave Miller, farmerhttps://www.herald-dispatch.com/elections/wv_candidates/w-va- commissioner-of-agriculture-candidate-dave- miller-d/article_9a73f136-67b2-11ea-8039-2f5a1ab0a80a.html ===== Withdrawn ===== * Patricia Bunner, attorneyhttps://www.avvo.com/attorneys/26570-wv- patricia-bunner-4510542.html === General election === ==Supreme Court of Appeals== ===Division 1=== https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_Supreme_Court_of_Appeals_elections,_2020#Division_1 The incumbent is Tim Armstead, who was appointed to the court to replace justice Menis Ketchum, who resigned from the court shortly before being convicted on a felony fraud charge. Armstead then won a 2018 special election to serve the remainder of Ketchum's term with 26.1% of the vote. He is seeking re-election to a full term.https://ballotpedia.org/Tim_Armstead ==== Candidates ==== ==== Declared ==== * Tim Armstead, incumbent justice and Chief Justice of the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appealshttps://ballotpedia.org/Tim_Armstead * David Hummel Jr., justice on the Second West Virginia Circuit Courthttps://ballotpedia.org/David_W._Hummel,_Jr. * Richard Neely, former Chief Justice of the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appealshttps://ballotpedia.org/Richard_Neely ===Division 2=== https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_Supreme_Court_of_Appeals_elections,_2020#Division_2 The incumbent is Margaret Workman, who was elected with 32.9% of the vote in 2008. She is not seeking re-election.https://ballotpedia.org/Margaret_Workman ==== Candidates ==== ==== Declared ==== * Jim Douglas, justice on the Eleventh West Virginia Circuit Courthttps://ballotpedia.org/Jim_Douglas * Kris Raynes, bar grader with the West Virginia Supreme Court Board of Law Examinershttps://ballotpedia.org/Kris_Raynes * Joanna Tabit, justice on the Thirteenth West Virginia Circuit Courthttps://ballotpedia.org/Joanna_I._Tabit * Bill Wooton, former state senator and candidate for the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals in 2016https://ballotpedia.org/William_Wooton ===Division 3=== https://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_Supreme_Court_of_Appeals_elections,_2020#Division_3 The incumbent is John A. Hutchison, who was appointed to the court to replace justice Allen Loughry, who resigned from the court in the midst of his impeachment trial. Hutchison is seeking re-election to serve the remainder of Loughry's term.https://ballotpedia.org/John_A._Hutchinsonhttps://ballotpedia.org/West_Virginia_judicial_elections,_2012 ==== Candidates ==== ==== Declared ==== * Lora Dyer, justice on the Fifth West Virginia Circuit Courthttps://ballotpedia.org/Lora_Dyer * John A. Hutchison, incumbent justicehttps://ballotpedia.org/John_A._Hutchinson * William Schwartz, attorneyhttps://www.schwartzforwv.com/ ==Notes== ==References== ==External links== * * * (State affiliate of the U.S. League of Women Voters) * * . title: 2020 West Virginia elections
